snippet: Arctic sea ice this summer shrank to its second lowest level since scientists started to monitor it by satellite, with scientists saying it is another ominous signal of global warming....
abstract: Arctic sea ice shrank to 1.6 million square miles in summer 2016, second-lowest level since scientists began satellite monitoring; some experts say global warming may mean Arctic may be free of ice in summertime by 2030.
lead_paragraph: Arctic sea ice this summer shrank to its second lowest level since scientists started to monitor it by satellite, with scientists saying it is another ominous signal of global warming.

headline.main: Arctic Ice Shrinks to Second Lowest Level on Record
headline.print_headline: The Big Melt: At This Rate, Arctic May Be Ice Free in Summer by 2030
